question_home2: If you feel sick with any of covid-19 symptomes please call immediatly for help using the following phone numbers.

question2: On which days of the week do you go to work ?

no_connection: Offline, Please turn on your Mobile Data
connected: Connected, Please pull your screen down to update
symptome_detail: People with COVID-19 have had a wide range of symptoms reported – ranging from mild symptoms to severe illness. Symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure to the virus. People with these symptoms may have COVID-19:
symptome3: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
symptome7: New loss of taste or smell
prevention1_detail: There is currently no vaccine to prevent coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).The best way to prevent illness is to avoid being exposed to this virus.The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person.Between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet).Through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs, sneezes or talks.
prevention2_detail: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds especially after you have been in a public place, or after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing.If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer that containsat least 60% alcohol. Cover all surfaces of your hands and rub them together until they feel dry.
prevention3_detail: Inside your home: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.If possible, maintain 6 feet between the person who is sick and other household members.Outside your home: Put 6 feet of distance between yourself and people whodon’t live in your household.Remember that some people without symptoms may be able to spread virus.Stay at least 6 feet (about 2 arms’ length) from other people.Keeping distance from others is especially important for people who are at higher risk of getting very sick.The mask is meant to protect other people in case you are infected.Everyone should wear a mask in public settings and when around people who don’t live in your household, especially when other social distancing measures are difficult to maintain.Continue to keep about 6 feet between yourself and others. The mask is not a substitute for social distancing.Throw used tissues in the trash.Immediately wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not readily available, clean your hands with a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
prevention4: Cover your mouth and nose with a mask when around others
prevention4_detail: You could spread COVID-19 to others even if you do not feel sick.
prevention5_detail: Always cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze or use the inside of your elbow and do not spit.
prevention6_detail: Clean AND disinfect frequently touched surfaces daily. This includes tables,doorknobs, light switches, countertops, handles, desks, phones, keyboards,toilets, faucets, and sinks.If surfaces are dirty, clean them. Use detergent or soap and water prior to disinfection.Then, use a household disinfectant. Most common EPA-registered household disinfectants will work.
mask1: Why it is important to wear a mask
mask1_detail: Masks may help prevent people who have COVID-19 from spreading the virus toothers. Wearing a mask will help protect people around you, including those at higher risk of severe illness from COVID-19 and workers who frequently come into close contact with other people. Masks are most likely to reduce the spread of COVID-19 when they are widely used by people in public settings along with other preventive measures, including social distancing, frequent handwashing,and cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched surfaces.
mask2: Wash your hands before putting on your mask.
mask3: Put it over your nose and mouth and secure it under your chin.
mask4: Try to fit it snugly against the sides of your face.
mask5: Make sure you can breathe easily.
mask6: Don’t put the mask around your neck or up on your forehead.
mask7: Don’t touch the mask, and, if you do, wash your hands or use hand sanitizer to disinfect.
mask8: Take Off Your Mask Carefully, When You’re Home
mask8_rule1: Untie the strings behind your head or stretch the ear loops.
mask8_rule2: Handle only by the ear loops or ties.
mask8_rule4: Be careful not to touch your eyes, nose, and mouth when removing and wash
sick1_detail: Keep separate bedroom and bathroom for a person who is sick (if possible).The person who is sick should stay separated from other people in the home If you have a separate bedroom and bathroom: Wear disposable glovesand only clean the area around the person who is sick when needed, such as when the area is soiled. This will help limit your contact with the person who is sick.If shared bathroom: The person who is sick shou ld clean anddisinfect after each use. If this is not possible, the caregiver should wait as long as possible before cleaning and disinfecting.
sick2_detail: Stay separated: The person who is sick should eat (or be fed) in their room if possible.Wash dishes and utensils using disposable gloves and hot water: Handle any used dishessses,, cups/gla or silverware with gloves. Wash them with soap and hot water or in a dishwasher.Clean hands after taking off gloves or handling used items.
sick3_detail: Use disposable gloves when handling and disposing of trash Dedicated, lined trash can: If possible, dedicate a lined trash can for the person who is sick. Use disposable gloves when removing garbage bags, and handling and disposing of trash. Wash hands afterwards.
tp1_detail: check your condition for any of Covid-19 symtomes before joining into crowed and getting into public transport.if its possible get covid test or have your temprture test.
tp2_detail: every one should wear a face mask before using public transport, including public transport drivers .ticketers and supervisors
tp3_detail: while you are inside public transports avoid crowdedness and close contact with other people as much as possible
tp4_detail: Every passanger should pracice avoiding touching the surfaces of the transport seats,horizotal and vertical bars,doors,windows and other parts that can be publicly touched.
tp5_detail: we should practice the culture of coverig our face and nose while coughing and sneezing
tp6_detail: You should avoid touching you face and while you are on the transport.
tp7_detail: we should give attention to people who are more vulnerrable to covid-19, espesially ealderly people and people with brathing difficulties
tp8_detail: respect directions given by people who are incharge like drivers, ticketers and supervisors
tp9_detail: We should wash our hands immiediatley after using punlic transports,if washing hand is possible use hand sanitizers
tp10_detail: Every person should develop the habit of keeping logs of people we meet,places where we have been,and if possible license plates or identification no of the public transport vehcile each day which helps during contact tracing
